sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Protests against Covid restrictions took place in cities across Europe on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In the Netherlands, thousands marched through the city of Utrecht.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The government imposed a partial lockdown in the country three weeks ago, and one of the unpopular restrictions includes bars, restaurants and public venues closing at 5pm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Around 1,200 police officers were deployed in the Austrian capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Several arrests were made for resisting state authority. Roadblocks were broken and pepper spray used. Two police officers were deployed in the Austrian capital. Several arrests were made for resisting state authority.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Roadblocks were broken and pepper spray used.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Two police officers were injured.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Protesters also demonstrated in Barcelona against the introduction of Covid-19 passports in the Spanish Autonomous Region of Catalonia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The virus law came into effect on Saturday after the courts authorised a request made by the regional government to introduce the measure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Almost 90 per cent of those eligible are vaccinated in Spain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And in Paris, caregivers and healthcare workers gathered in front of the Ministry of Health to demand an end to the closure of beds in public hospitals and better working conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Demonstrators held banners that read, save your hospital, it will save you one day, and public hospitals must not die.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Let's demand an emergency plan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: German Chancellor designate Olaf Scholz is one step closer to officially taking over from Angela Merkel after his own

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: SPD party gave its overwhelming approval for a deal to form a new government with the Greens and the Free Democratic Party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: for a deal to form a new government with the Greens and the Free Democratic Party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Dubbed the Traffic Light Coalition, it will be the first time all three parties will jointly rule Germany.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Speaking at the SPD Congress on Saturday, Schulz said, Progress.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: That's what distinguishes us, the SPD, the Greens and the FDP.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And that also distinguishes us from others who sit on the opposite benches of the German Bundestag, seeing that we have ideas that we actually want to see them through." Although now understood to be just a formality, Scholz faces three more votes before he can take over as Chancellor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The discontent of those gathered is mainly directed at the president of Serbia, Aleksandar Vucic, but also at the mining company Rio Tinto, which is preparing to dig for lithium in a project that's been controversial for almost two decades.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Many fear that the government recently amended the laws on referendum and expropriation in order to facilitate the lithium mining which environmentalists say would cause irreparable damage to the environment.

sentences.sentence: We have come to stand up together with the citizens against everything that is happening in our country. I think the reasons for this protest are dissatisfaction with how Serbia is developing and how the regime of the Serbian Progressive Party is behaving and governing.

sentences.sentence: loud explosion close to Iran's main nuclear facilities on Saturday Iranian state media were quick to explain that it was part of a controlled test.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: According to sources close to the country's security forces, an air defence missile was fired and exploded in the sky as part of a rapid reaction test.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The explosion and the flash of light were reported in Badroud, some 20 kilometres from the Natanz enrichment facilities that are located in central Iran.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Authorities say that no damage was caused to the area by the air defence drills.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: However, the Natanz nuclear facilities have previously been the target of sabotage attacks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: As part of his five-day tour of Cyprus and Greece, Pope Francis returned to Lesbos on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: His last visit to the island was in 2016, during the early years of the migration crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Part of his eastern Mediterranean tour is aimed at drawing attention to the suffering of migrants and refugees.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He even declared that Europe is torn by nationalist egoism on the matter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Many refugees welcomed his visit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I have this kind of feeling to welcome pop on this island. It's going to be very good hope for the refugees inside the camp, even they are Muslim, even they are Christian. For all of us, it is very, very good things. And we believe that when the Pope will leave and the situation of the refugee's life inside the camp will change and it's going to be better, much more than now." This refugee says the Pope's visit is very important, especially for those who have spent already two years on the island of Lesbos.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: During his meeting with the Archbishop of Athens, Francis brought up the problem of migration and solidarity. The 84-year-old's visit to the Greek capital on Saturday was the first by a Pope since John Paul II in 2001.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: His trip is also focused on improving recently mended ties between the Vatican and Greek Orthodox churches.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Since the Taliban took control of Afghanistan, there have been high levels of uncertainty for the young and old alike.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Many like these undergraduate students are at a crucial stage of their education.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And they are worried about the future.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Some feel the war and this new regime may have put an end to their careers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But the challenge to their education is not the only threat.

The humanitarian crisis is escalating daily in Afghanistan. Hunger in the country has reached truly unprecedented levels. Nearly 23 million people, that's 55% That's 55% of the population are facing extreme levels of hunger and nearly 9 million of them are at risk of famine." Across the country, economic hardships have forced people to find new jobs in order to earn a living.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In Kandahar, some people have even turned to harvesting opium poppies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This man says he used to get up early in the morning to earn some money for his parents, then he went to school for half a day to prepare for his exams.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Now he says the situation has changed and he can't earn enough, so he is growing opium poppies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The United Nations Refugee Agency has urged for much more support for the tens of thousands of people displaced in Afghanistan in 2021. In 2013, a mountaineer taking on their arduous journey up Mont Blanc stumbled across a treasure

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: that had been hidden underneath the snow and ice for decades.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He found a box of precious stones linked to a 1966 plane crash on the mountain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The mountaineer discovered a box of treasures, including other goods, and we are about to open it and go through it now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Establishing ownership of the finding has been an ongoing issue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Lacking any claim after eight years, the law states that half of the treasure goes to the discoverer and the other half goes to the state.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And on Friday, that deadline was passed, and the mountaineer was informed that he would be receiving his share, estimated to be worth 150,000 euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Wishing to remain anonymous, the mountaineer said, I didn't believe it would happen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's really too much.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I'm going to put it into an account without going overboard.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It is thought the 6,000 pieces of precious stones originated from a dealer who was travelling on the Air India flight before tragedy struck.
